ioio.lib.util

Class IOIOConnectionManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • ioio.lib.util.IOIOConnectionManager

  • public static class IOIOConnectionManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages IOIO threads per connection.

    This class will take care of creating a thread for each possible IOIO connection, and cleaning up these threads. Client is responsible for providing the actual threads, by implementing the IOIOConnectionThreadProvider interface.

    Basic usage is:

    • Create a IOIOConnectionManager instance, pass a IOIOConnectionThreadProvider.
    • Call #start(). This will invoke IOIOConnectionThreadProvider#createThreadFromFactory(IOIOConnectionFactory) for every possible connection (more precisely, for every IOIOConnectionFactory). Return null if you do not wish to create a thread for a certain connection type.
    • When done, call #stop(). This will call Thread#abort() for each running thread and then join them.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
